results.title: Salam Cafe. Episode 13 (Season  2)
results.creator_credit: C31 Melbourne, Jehed Dabab and Ahmed Hassan
results.brief_description: ‘Salam Café has no group or organisational affiliation - we’re just a group of mates who thought it might be good to give Melbourne a window on everyday Muslims, and have fun at the same time!’ In this episode Salam Cafe 2 Go visit the MCG on the Grand Final day. The panel interview Qamar Atosh, the National Winner of the YAMY award. Along with our previous guest Monique to discuss the YAMY night. In the absense of Susan, her husband Waleed reveals the winner of the photo comp. We hear about the recent Declaration of Faith Based Schools drafted by representatives of Christian, Jewish and Islamic Colleges.

results.title: C31: Season 50 presentation
results.brief_description: A montage of clips from the history of C 31 - Melbourne’s community TV station. Established in 1994, C31 gained a full license in 2002 and now attracts over 1 million viewers every month. This montage was produced to celebrate the 50th 13 season broadcast and presents some of the breadth and diversity of C31 programming, as well as a potted history of the station and its achicevements over the last 12 years.

results.title: A young girls journey to the other side of the world
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Maria Sourtzis
results.brief_description: This is a story of migration through the eyes of a young girl. Maria recounts the long journey by boat, the memories of Bonegilla migrant reception centre and her early life in Melbourne.
results.title_for_label: A young girls journey to the other side of the world

results.title: The Story of an immigrant filmmaker
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Agnes Karlik
results.brief_description: Agnes was separated from her mother and sisters when she migrated from post war Europe with her father. Her father was a filmmaker and documents their journey on the ship and their arrival to a transit camp in Western Australia. This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.
results.description: Agnes was separated from her mother and sisters when she migrated from post war Europe with her father. Her father was a filmmaker and documents their journey on the ship and their arrival to a transit camp in Western Australia. This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.

Her father was a filmmaker and documents their journey on the ship and their arrival to a transit camp in Western Australia. This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.

results.title: Possums of Bonegilla
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Agnes Karlik
results.brief_description: Agnes talks of her migrant experience including her time spent at Bonegilla. She especially focuses on friendships made during those early years of alienation and loneliness.
results.description: Agnes talks of her migrant experience including her time spent at Bonegilla. She especially focuses on friendships made during those early years of alienation and loneliness.

results.title: New beginnings
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Stella Paraskakis
results.brief_description: Migrating to a new country as a young girl can be an overwhelming experience. This story captures the memories of life in a new country by a young girl who migrated to Australia from Greece with her family.
results.description: Migrating to a new country as a young girl can be an overwhelming experience. This story captures the memories of life in a new country by a young girl who migrated to Australia from Greece with her family.
description_for_label: Migrating to a new country as a young girl can be an overwhelming experience. This story captures the memories of life in a new country by a young girl who migrated to Australia from Greece with her family.

results.title: Leaving Tropeoulhos
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Anastasia Solomidis
results.brief_description: Anastasia and her husband lived in a village in Greece. One day a government official arrived to ask whether they would consider migrating to Australia. They talked about it and decided that they had better take up this opportunity to improve their lives and provide opportunities for their children.

They talked about it and decided that they had better take up this opportunity to improve their lives and provide opportunities for their children.

results.title: A Journey to freedom
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Helen Schloetzer
results.brief_description: Helen survived life in a German detention camp, her life was completely disrupted by the horror of war. Helen and her family were displaced persons when they migrated to Australia. Helen and her family found themselves transiting to Bonegilla, temporary accommodation for new migrants who had exchanged free or assisted passage to Australia.
results.description: Helen survived life in a German detention camp, her life was completely disrupted by the horror of war. Helen and her family were displaced persons when they migrated to Australia. Helen and her family found themselves transiting to Bonegilla, temporary accommodation for new migrants who had exchanged free or assisted passage to Australia.
description_for_label: Helen survived life in a German detention camp, her life was completely disrupted by the horror of war. Helen and her family were displaced persons when they migrated to Australia. Helen and her family found themselves transiting to Bonegilla, temporary accommodation for new migrants who had exchanged free or assisted passage to Australia.

results.title: From Graz to Glenroy
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Elfrieda Senycia and Viv Mehes
results.brief_description: This story explores the journey of migration from Austria to Australia for Elfrida and her husband. As they rebuild life in a new country they deal with triumps and disappointments including the humiliation of never having their qualifications recognised in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Elfrieda Senycia and Viv Mehes
